mdRecord.dcterms:title: Tramp! tramp! tramp!: The prisoner's hope
In the prison-cell I sit
Prisoner's hope
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Magnus, Charles.
Root, George F. (George Frederick), 1820-1895
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in 3 verses, with chorus; without music. Printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: In the prison-cell I sit.
Charles Magnus is listed at 12 Frankfort St. in New York City directories for 1861 through 1867.
"The music of this song can be obtained at the well known Music-Store of Frederick Blume, 208 Bowery, New York." -- beneath title.
With advertisement "Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 cts. Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St., N.Y."
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.
Hand-colored headpiece of battle scene with Union officers conferring on hilltop with cannon in lower left corner, Magnus 100.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Eighth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
